An animated object is a construct with AC, hit points, attacks, Strength, and Dexterity determined by its size. Its Constitution is 10 and its Intelligence and Wisdom are 3, and its Charisma is 1. Its speed is 30 feet; if the object lacks legs or other appendages it can use for locomotion, it instead has a flying speed of 30 feet and can hover. If the object is securely attached to a surface or a larger object, such as a chain bolted to a wall, its speed is 0. It has blindsight with a radius of 30 feet and is blind beyond that distance. When the animated object drops to 0 hit points, it reverts to its original object form, and any remaining damage carries over to its original object form.

If you command an object to attack, it can make a single melee attack against a creature within 5 feet of it. It makes a slam attack with an attack bonus and bludgeoning damage determined by its size. The DM might rule that a specific object inflicts slashing or piercing damage based on its form.

At Higher Levels.

If you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you can animate two additional objects for each slot level above 5th.

Plex.name: Telekinesis
Plex.description:
You gain the ability to move or manipulate creatures or objects by thought. When you cast the spell, and as your action each round for the duration, you can exert your will on one creature or object that you can see within range, causing the appropriate effect below. You can affect the same target round after round, or choose a new one at any time. If you switch targets, the prior target is no longer affected by the spell.

Creature

You can try to move a Huge or smaller creature. Make an ability check with your spellcasting ability contested by the creature's Strength check. If you win the contest, you move the creature up to 30 feet in any direction, including upward but not beyond the range of this spell. Until the end of your next turn, the creature is &Reference[condition=restrained] in your telekinetic grip. A creature lifted upward is suspended in mid-air.

On subsequent rounds, you can use your action to attempt to maintain your telekinetic grip on the creature by repeating the contest.

Object

You can try to move an object that weighs up to 1,000 pounds. If the object isn't being worn or carried, you automatically move it up to 30 feet in any direction, but not beyond the range of this spell.

If the object is worn or carried by a creature, you must make an ability check with your spellcasting ability contested by that creature's Strength check. If you succeed, you pull the object away from that creature and can move it up to 30 feet in any direction but not beyond the range of this spell.

You can exert fine control on objects with your telekinetic grip, such as manipulating a simple tool, opening a door or a container, stowing or retrieving an item from an open container, or pouring the contents from a vial.

Plex.name: Triggered: Greater Restoration - 9th
Plex.description:
9th Level

Whenever I'm inflicted with any effect this spell can remove apart from cursed.

You imbue a creature you touch with positive energy to undo a debilitating effect. You can reduce the target's exhaustion level by one, or end one of the following effects on the target:

One effect that &Reference[condition=charmed] or &Reference[condition=petrified] the target

One curse, including the target's attunement to a cursed magic item

Any reduction to one of the target's ability scores

One effect reducing the target's hit point maximum

Plex.name: Mess Kit
Plex.description: This tin box contains a cup and simple cutlery. The box clamps together, and one side can be used as a cooking pan and the other as a plate or shallow bowl.

Plex.name: Activated: Circle of Death - 9th
Plex.description:
9th Level

A sphere of negative energy ripples out in a 60-foot radius from a point within range. Each creature in that area must make a Constitution saving throw. A target takes 8d6 necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Higher Levels
When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases by 2d6 for each slot level above 6th.

Plex.name: Activated: Inflict Wounds - 5th
Plex.description:
5th Level

Make a melee spell attack against a creature you can reach. On a hit, the target takes 3d10 necrotic damage.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d10 for each slot level above 1st.

Plex.name: Dodge
Plex.description: When you take the Dodge action, you focus entirely on avoiding attacks. Until the start of your next turn, any attack roll made against you has disadvantage if you can see the attacker, and you make Dexterity saving throws with advantage. You lose this benefit if you are incapacitated (as explained in the appendix) or if your speed drops to 0.

Plex.name: Mantle of the Arcane Trickster
Plex.description: While you're protected by the Mage Armor spell, you gain the benefits of the Gift of Alacrity and Veil of Dusk spells, the latter without requiring concentration.

Plex.name: Mindblasting Cap
Plex.description:
This soft, violet cap bears stitching in the pattern of folds on a brain.

As a bonus action while wearing the cap, you can project psychic energy in a 60-foot cone. Each creature in that area must make a DC 15 Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes [[/r 5d8]] psychic damage and has the stunned condition for 1 minute. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage only. At the end of each of its turns, a stunned creature can repeat the saving throw, ending the stunned condition on itself on a success.

Once this bonus action is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

Plex.name: Guardian Scale of Conjuration
Plex.description:
A creature can only have one Guardian Scale equipped at any given time.

While you have this scale equipped, you can cast @UUID[Compendium.talia-custom.customItems.Item.RyWWNetB7VaYntCu]{Dimension Door} (1/day) and @UUID[Compendium.talia-custom.customItems.Item.DUxpJqmt2fNeT7gF]{Mage Hand}.

The ancient magic of this scale alters these spells. They require no concentration or components, can be cast while raging and have a flat spell save DC of [[12 + @prof]] and a flat spell attack bonus of [[4+@prof]].

Additionally, the cantrip this item grants has a casting time of 1 bonus action.

Plex.name: Guardian Scale of Illusion
Plex.description:
A creature can only have one Guardian Scale equipped at any given time.

While you have this scale equipped, you can cast @UUID[Compendium.talia-custom.customItems.Item.LJwGiaDUaBc1zpEC]{Phantasmal Horror} (1/day) and @UUID[Compendium.talia-custom.customItems.Item.aexNnsENNJ7MCZv0]{Minor Illusion}.

The ancient magic of this scale alters these spells. They require no concentration or components, can be cast while raging and have a flat spell save DC of [[12 + @prof]] and a flat spell attack bonus of [[4+@prof]].

Additionally, the cantrip this item grants has a casting time of 1 bonus action.

Plex.name: Mythic Power
Plex.description:
The path of the Trickster is a wild ride through a universe of infinite possibilities. Chosen by Picoperi, the Azata Lord of of chaos and mischief, the Trickster is a force of nature, shaping reality itself with a playful disregard for order. But this path is a dangerous dance with unintended consequences.

Mythic characters can draw upon a wellspring of power to accomplish amazing deeds and cheat fate. This power is used by a number of different abilities.

Each week, you can expend an amount of mythic power equal to 2 + twice your mythic rank.

This amount is your maximum amount of mythic power. If an ability allows you to regain uses of your mythic power, you can never have more than this amount.

Plex.name: Master of Chance
Plex.description: When you make any skill check, roll an additional [[/r d12]]. If it lands on a 12, you gain a bonus to that skill check equal to 5 times your Charisma modifier.

Plex.name: Fishy Magic
Plex.description:
When you cast a spell that targets only one creature and doesn't have a range of self, you can spend 1 Mythic Power to target a second creature in range with the same spell.

If the spell fires a projectile, the projectile looks like a fish. If the spell doesn't, all targeted creatures smell like fish.

Plex.name: Echoing Crystalbloom
Plex.description:
When this crystalline flower shatters, it covers creatures in a 10ft sphere in it's fine dust unless they succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against the contraption's save DC.

Any creature covered by the dust involuntarily echoes it’s own speech for 10 minutes, making it much more difficult to form the verbal components of spells.

While under this effect, casting a spell with verbal components requires a bonus action and the caster's full movement in addition to the spells normal requirements.

Plex.name: Arcane Gate
Plex.description:
You create linked teleportation portals that remain open for the duration. Choose two points on the ground that you can see, one point within 10 feet of you and one point within 500 feet of you. A circular portal, 10 feet in diameter, opens over each point. If the portal would open in the space occupied by a creature, the spell fails, and the casting is lost.

The portals are two-dimensional glowing rings filled with mist, hovering inches from the ground and perpendicular to it at the points you choose. A ring is visible only from one side (your choice), which is the side that functions as a portal.

Any creature or object entering the portal exits from the other portal as if the two were adjacent to each other; passing through a portal from the nonportal side has no effect. The mist that fills each portal is opaque and blocks vision through it. On your turn, you can rotate the rings as a bonus action so that the active side faces in a different direction.

Plex.name: Contingency
Plex.description:
Choose a spell of 5th level or lower that you can cast, that has a casting time of 1 action, and that can target you. You cast that spell—called the contingent spell—as part of casting contingency, expending spell slots for both, but the contingent spell doesn't come into effect. Instead, it takes effect when a certain circumstance occurs. You describe that circumstance when you cast the two spells. For example, a contingency cast with water breathing might stipulate that water breathing comes into effect when you are engulfed in water or a similar liquid.

The contingent spell takes effect immediately after the circumstance is met for the first time, whether or not you want it to, and then contingency ends.

The contingent spell takes effect only on you, even if it can normally target others. You can use only one contingency spell at a time. If you cast this spell again, the effect of another contingency spell on you ends. Also, contingency ends on you if its material component is ever not on your person.

Plex.name: Cane of Tides
Plex.description:
Requires attunement by a spellcaster.

You gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls and to the saving throw DCs of your spells.

The cane has 8 charges and regains 1d8 expended charges when you finish a long rest. You can use the following abilities by expending charges:

  • Add damage: When you cast a spell that deals bludgeoning or cold damage, you can expend 1 or more charges to add an additional 1d8 damage of the same type for each charge you expend.

  • Create Water: You can expend 1 charge to cast the Create Water effect of the Create or Destroy Water spell at 1st level using a bonus action.

  • Maelstrom: You can expend 5 charges to cast Maelstrom at 5th level.

Plex.name: Create Water
Plex.description: You create up to 10 gallons of clean water within range in an open container. Alternatively, the water falls as rain in a 30-foot cube within range, extinguishing exposed flames in the area.

Plex.name: Maelstrom
Plex.description:
A swirling mass of 5-foot-deep water appears in a 30-foot radius centered on a point you can see within range. The point must be on the ground or in a body of water.

Until the spell ends, that area is difficult terrain, and any creature that starts its turn there must succeed on a Strength saving throw or take 6d6 bludgeoning damage and be pulled 10 feet toward the center. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and is not pulled towards the center.

Plex.name: Instant Door
Plex.description:
This item resembles an ornate key of bright copper, often inset with semi-precious stones or detailed with engraved filigree scrollwork and ornaments.

While holding the key, you can use an action to make a turning motion to create a door in any wall within 5 feet of you. This door goes through a wall up to 5 feet thick, creating an exit that remains until you remove it. Turning the key in the opposite direction turns any normal, non‑magical door into a section of stone or other material matching the wall to either side (wood, wattle, plaster, and so on).

Plex.name: Wine of the Winter Court
Plex.description:
This wine, so dark red in color it is nearly black, pours from its bottle in a syrupy flow. When you drink it, you taste notes of sour apple, bitter ash, and jealousy, and your thoughts are occupied with vivid memories of heartbreak and loss.

When you drink this wine, you have disadvantage on Charisma ability checks for 1 hour, but you are immune to being &Reference[condition=charmed] and can add your proficiency bonus to Wisdom saving throws for the duration. If you already add your proficiency bonus to Wisdom saving throws, your bonus is instead doubled for the duration.

Plex.name: Shadow Lantern
Plex.description:
During each full or new moon, you can activate this lantern to transport it, yourself and up to six willing creatures to the Forest in Shadows. All of you reappear at the exact location where the lantern last exited the Forest in Shadows.

As an action, you can light the lantern for 12 hours. When lit, it emits a ghostly but bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. While within this light, creatures are immune to the effects of the Banishment spell and other similar effects.

Once the lantern has been lit, it cannot be lit again until you finish a long rest.

Plex.name: Soul Coin
Plex.description:
Soul coins are about 5 inches across and about an inch thick, minted from infernal iron. Each coin weighs one-third of a pound, and is inscribed with Infernal writing and a spell that magically binds a single soul to the coin. Because each soul coin has a unique soul trapped within it, each has a story. A creature might have been imprisoned as a result of defaulting on a deal, while another might be the victim of a night hag's curse.

Carrying Soul Coins

To hold a soul coin is to feel the soul bound within it—overcome with rage or fraught with despair.

An evil creature can carry as many soul coins as it wishes (up to its maximum weight allowance). A non-evil creature can carry a number of soul coins equal to or less than its Constitution modifier without penalty. A non-evil creature carrying a number of soul coins greater than its Constitution modifier has disadvantage on its attack rolls, ability checks, and saving throws.

Freeing a Soul

Casting a spell that removes a curse on a soul coin frees the soul trapped within it, as does expending all of the coin's charges. The coin itself rusts from within and is destroyed once the soul is released. A freed soul travels to the realm of the god it served or the outer plane most closely tied to its alignment (DM's choice). The souls of lawful evil creatures released from soul coins typically emerge from the River Styx as devils.

Freeing a soul from a soul coin is considered a good act, even if the soul belongs to an evil creature.

Hellish Currency

Soul coins are a currency of the Nine Hells and are highly valued by devils. The coins are used among the infernal hierarchy to barter for favours, bribe the unwilling, and reward the faithful for services rendered.

Soul coins are created by Mammon and his greater devils on Minauros, the third layer of the Nine Hells, in a vast chamber where the captured souls of evil mortals are bound into the coins. These coins are then distributed throughout the Nine Hells to be used for goods and services, infernal deals, dark bargains, and bribes.

Unmake a Soul

When casting a spell which requires repeated castings for it's effects to become permanent, soul coins can be expended as a material component and the souls trapped inside unmade. Each soul coin expended this way reduces the number of required castings by three.

Unmaking a soul is different to freeing it as doing so erases the soul from existence itself, it's essence lost forever. Unmaking a soul is considered an evil act.

Plex.name: Wooden Chicken Statue with Knife beak
Troll Musk Concentrate
Plex.description:
When this flask hits a creature or object, it bursts open and covers the target in a green liquid, a potent aphrodisiac for trolls.

Upon coming into contact with a living creature, this fatty substance creates a 10ft sphere of foul odour around that creature which persists for 10 minutes.

When a creature enters the effect’s area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, that creature must make a Constitution saving throw against the contraption’s Save DC or become Poisoned until the start of their next turn.

When a troll fails a saving throw against this effect, it becomes Charmed instead of poisoned.

Plex.name: Greater Invisibility
Plex.description: You or a creature you touch becomes &Reference[condition=invisible] until the spell ends. Anything the target is wearing or carrying is &Reference[condition=invisible] as long as it is on the target's person.

Plex.name: Weaver's Tools
Plex.description:
These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade in weaving.

Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

Plex.name: Vestments
Plex.description: Simple or ostentacious wear, often used by priests and other religious figures for use in rituals and ceremonies.

Plex.name: Bedroll
Plex.description: Roll of cloth used by traveller to sleep in.

Plex.name: Breezeblossom
Plex.description: It’s petals will always be carried away by a gentle breeze, going as far to create one themselves if needed. This breeze disperses any magical cloud or fog effects.

Plex.name: Vanishing Velvet
Plex.description:
Upon coming into contact with water, this moss turns itself and any creature it's covering mostly invisible for 10 minutes.

During combat, an affected creature rolls a 1d10 at the start of every combatant's turn, loosing it's invisibility on a 1 and regaining or maintaining it on a roll of 2 or higher.

Plex.name: Prismatic Thistle
Plex.description:
Sticks stubbornly to any creature it hits, making it's outline glow vibrantly, shedding bright light in a radius of 5ft.

Any attack roll against the affected creature has advantage if the attacker can see it, and the affected creature can’t benefit from being invisible.

The effect ends if the creature removes the thistle using an action, or after 10 minutes.

Plex.name: Fanzy robe
Plex.description:
Save DC: 19 | Attack Bonus: 12

Mechanism

A fancy dress Robe that hides two secret vials in the hood.
Breaking any of the vials triggers its content. ( a lucky hit in the head by an enemy can also trigger the effects)

Plex.name: Echoing Crystalbloom
Plex.description:
When this crystalline flower shatters, it covers creatures in a 10ft sphere in it's fine dust unless they succeed on a Dexterity saving throw against the contraption's save DC.

Any creature covered by the dust involuntarily echoes it’s own speech for 10 minutes, making it much more difficult to form the verbal components of spells.

While under this effect, casting a spell with verbal components requires a bonus action and the caster's full movement in addition to the spells normal requirements.

Plex.name: Chili Pepper
Plex.description: Harvested usually in most warm climates, it is used mainly as a spice in cuisines to add some "warmth" to the dish.

Plex.name: Enlarge/Reduce
Plex.description:
You cause a creature or an object you can see within range to grow larger or smaller for the duration. Choose either a creature or an object that is neither worn nor carried. If the target is unwilling, it can make a Constitution saving throw. On a success, the spell has no effect.

If the target is a creature, everything it is wearing and carrying changes size with it. Any item dropped by an affected creature returns to normal size at once.

Enlarge

The target's size doubles in all dimensions, and its weight is multiplied by eight. This growth increases its size by one category—from Medium to Large, for example. If there isn't enough room for the target to double its size, the creature or object attains the maximum possible size in the space available. Until the spell ends, the target also has advantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws. The target's weapons also grow to match its new size. While these weapons are enlarged, the target's attacks with them deal [[/r 1d4]] extra damage.

Reduce

The target's size is halved in all dimensions, and its weight is reduced to one-eighth of normal. This reduction decreases its size by one category—from Medium to Small, for example. Until the spell ends, the target also has disadvantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws. The target's weapons also shrink to match its new size. While these weapons are reduced, the target's attacks with them deal [[/r 1d4]] less damage (this can't reduce the damage below 1).

Plex.name: Dreamfeather
Plex.description:
A Dreamfeather is an exceedingly rare and delicate token from the plane of Elysium. These iridescent feathers belong to the Aethergale, small and ethereal songbirds whose rainbow-tinted plumage usually vanishes when shed. However, when an Aethergale is moved by a performance of true beauty and passion—be it a bard's heartfelt song or an artist's soul-stirring creation—a feather may fall and remain intact, becoming what is known as a Dreamfeather.

Treasured and used as a currency by the Azata, the celestial beings of Elysium, Dreamfeathers are regarded as symbols artistic spirit. To find such a feather is seen as an acknowledgment of one’s creativity and emotional depth. They emit a faint glow, and their touch brings a gentle feeling of calm, as though carrying the nostalgia-filled songs of the Aethergale itself.

Shared Inspiration

A creature holding a Dreamfeather can use it to transfer one of it's inspirations to another creature it can see. This consumes the magic which resides in the feather and it vanishes into nothingness. A creature which doesn't have any inspirations, cannot use this ability.

Plex.name: Medallion of Thoughts
Plex.description:
Wondrous item, (requires attunement)

The medallion has 3 charges. While wearing it, you can use an action and expend 1 charge to cast the @Compendium[dnd5e.spells.ppWAAEul0QHtm4er]{Detect Thoughts} spell (save DC 13) from it. The medallion regains 1d3 expended charges when you finish a long rest.

Plex.name: Sun Statue
Plex.description:
Requires attunement by a spellcaster

This statue can be used as a spellcasting focus and grants a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and spell save DC.

You can use it to cast the Sunbeam spell using your spell save DC once per day without expending a spell slot.

Plex.name: Sunbeam
Plex.description:
A beam of brilliant light flashes out from your hand in a 5-foot-wide, 60-foot-long line. Each creature in the line must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes [[/damage 6d8 type=radiant]] damage and is &Reference[condition=blinded] until your next turn. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage and isn't &Reference[condition=blinded] by this spell. Undead and oozes have disadvantage on this saving throw.

You can create a new line of radiance as your action on any turn until the spell ends.

For the duration, a mote of brilliant radiance shines in your hand. It sheds bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet. This light is sunlight.

Plex.name: Towering Pillar of Hats
Plex.description:
Only true gentlemen know that even a hat deserves a hat.

Each hat you have equipped grants you +1 to your Charisma score.

Plex.name: Sneaky Spellshite's Amulet
Plex.description:
The critical range of spell attacks you make while hiding or invisible is increased by 2.

Once per turn, when you make a spell attack while hiding or invisible, you can add an extra 1d6 damage per character level to that attack's damage roll.

Plex.name: Important Bowl to a dead man
Plex.description: A bowl with scratch marks on the inside

Plex.name: Call of the Void
Plex.description:
With a flick of your wrist, you rend open the fabric of reality, creating a rift to the Far Realms. A writhing, unnatural void fills the air, exuding an eerie silence and drawing everything around it into its alien darkness.

When a creature enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pulled into the Far Realms. On a failed save, the creature is instantly transported to the Far Realms, engulfed by its chaotic and mind-shattering landscape. If the saving throw succeeds, the creature takes 8d10 acid damage and 8d10 cold damage as it resists the void’s pull.

If a creature is more than 5 feet away from the rift’s edge, it automatically fails the saving throw, having nothing to grasp as it is dragged toward the void. Whenever a creature fails the saving throw and is transported to the Far Realms, the radius of the rift expands by 5 feet, its influence creeping ever outward.

A single caster can have only one active rift created by Call of the Void on a plane at any given time. If a caster attempts to create a second rift while their original rift remains open, the spell fails. Multiple casters, however, can each maintain their own rift on the same plane.

A caster can close their own rift by using dispel magic cast at 6th level or higher, focusing their magic on the rift to stitch the tear shut and end the spell’s effects.

Plex.name: Versatility through Unpredictability
Plex.description:
As a bonus action, you can attempt to swap a prepared spell with an unprepared spell. Choose a prepared spell, then roll a [[/r d20]].

On a roll of 10 or lower, you must replace the chosen prepared spell with an unprepared spell of a lower spell level.
On a roll of 11 or higher, you must replace the chosen prepared spell with an unprepared spell of a higher spell level.

If the result would force you to choose an unprepared spell of a higher level than your highest available spell slot, the swap fails and the chosen prepared spell remains unchanged. The same applies if the roll would force you to swap a 1st-level spell for a spell of a lower level.

Plex.name: Mage Wine
Plex.description: If you are capable of casting spells from the wizard's spell list, then when you drink this rich red potion, you will instantly regain one spell slot that you cast earlier in the day. Roll a [[/r 1d4]] to determine the slot level. If you haven't used any slots of that level, you regain the lowest level slot you have used.

Plex.name: Spell Scroll: Globe of Invulnerability
Plex.description:
An immobile, faintly shimmering barrier springs into existence in a 10-foot radius around you and remains for the duration.

Any spell of 5th level or lower cast from outside the barrier can't affect creatures or objects within it, even if the spell is cast using a higher level spell slot. Such a spell can target creatures and objects within the barrier, but the spell has no effect on them. Similarly, the area within the barrier is excluded from the areas affected by such spells.

At Higher Levels.

When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the barrier blocks spells of one level higher for each slot level above 6th.

Plex.name: Temporal Shunt
Plex.description:
You target the triggering creature, which must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or vanish, being thrown to another point in time and causing the attack to miss or the spell to be wasted. At the start of its next turn, the target reappears where it was or in the closest unoccupied space. The target doesn't remember you casting the spell or being affected by it.

At Higher Levels.

When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, you can target one additional creature for each slot level above 5th. All targets must be within 30 feet of each other.

Plex.name: Gravity Fissure
Plex.description:
You manifest a ravine of gravitational energy in a line originating from you that is 100 feet long and 5 feet wide. Each creature in that line must make a Constitution saving throw, taking [[/damage 8d8 type=force]] damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Each creature within 10 feet of the line but not in it must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take [[/damage 8d8 type=force]] damage and be pulled toward the line until the creature is in its area.

At Higher Levels.

When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, the damage increases by [[/damage 1d8]] for each slot level above 6th.

Plex.name: Vortex Swap
Plex.description:
You magically twist space around two creatures you can see within range simultaneously. Each target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw (each target can choose to fail), or get teleported to the location the other target occupied when you cast the spell.

If this spell would cause a target that was teleported to occupy the same spot as a solid object or creature, it is immediately shunted to the nearest unoccupied space that it can occupy and takes [[/damage 4d6 type=force]] damage.

At Higher Levels.

When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the range of the spell increases by 30 feet for each slot level above 4th. If cast using a spell slot of 7th level or higher, you can choose to cast this spell as a reaction, which you take immediately after initiative has been rolled.

Plex.name: Bottle of Bagiennik Snot
Plex.description:
As repulsive as many might find the snot of the frog-like Bagiennik, they cannot deny it's healing abilities.

You regain 8d4 + 8 hit points when you drink this potion.

Plex.name: Felt Hat (Two-Person Tent)
Plex.description: A simple and portable canvas shelter, a tent sleeps two.

Plex.name: Microscopic Proportions
Plex.description:
You cause a creature or an object you can see within range to shrink for the duration. Choose either a creature or an object that is neither worn nor carried. If the target is unwilling, it can make a Constitution saving throw. On a success, the spell has no effect.

If the target is a creature, everything it is wearing and carrying changes size with it. Any item dropped by an affected creature returns to normal size at once.

The target's size is quartered in all dimensions, and its weight is reduced to one-sixteenth of normal. This reduction decreases its size by up to two categories—from Medium to Tiny, for example. Until the spell ends, the target also has disadvantage on Strength checks and Strength saving throws as well as advantage on Dexterity checks and Dexterity saving throws. The target's weapons also shrink to match its new size. While these weapons are reduced, the target's attacks with them deal [[/damage 2d4]] less damage (this can't reduce the damage below 1).

Plex.name: Convincing Arguments
Plex.description:
When you or a creature you can see within 300 feet becomes affected by one or more conditions, you can use your reaction and expend 1 Mythic Power to attempt to convince the affected creature that the conditions are merely figments of its imagination.

Choose one condition affecting the target and make a [[/skill dec]] check against the target’s passive Wisdom (Insight). On a success, the chosen condition ends. You may repeat this process for each additional condition affecting the target.

If any of these Charisma (Deception) checks results in a natural 20, you can end any number of conditions currently affecting the target, regardless of the other results.

Plex.name: A Series of Unfortunate Events
Plex.description:
Whenever a hostile creature within 300 feet rolls a natural 1 on its initiative, it dies immediately. You are free to narrate the cause of its death in any manner you like as long as it doesn't mechanically impact any other creature or the environment.

If it rolls a natural 20 instead, a perfect duplicate of the creature, including its items and equipment, appears in the closest unoccupied space and immediately after the original creature in initiative order (without rolling for initiative). The original and its duplicate immediately become hostile towards one another, each believing themselves to be the 'real' one.

Plex.name: Jump
Plex.description: Using your bonus action, you can jump up to [[/r @talia.jumpDistance]] ft.

Plex.name: Grapple
Plex.description:
When you want to grab a creature or wrestle with it, you can use the Attack action to make a special melee attack, a grapple. If you're able to make multiple attacks with the Attack action, this attack replaces one of them. The target of your grapple must be no more than one size larger than you, and it must be within your reach.

Using at least one free hand, you try to seize the target by making a grapple check, a [[/skill ath format=long]] contested by the target's [[/skill ath format=long]] or [[/skill acr format=long]] (the target chooses the ability to use). You succeed automatically if the target is incapacitated. If you succeed, you subject the target to the &Reference[grappled] effect. The condition specifies the things that end it, and you can release the target whenever you like (no action required).

Plex.name: Jim's Lance of Compensation
Plex.description:
Jim was very proud of his lance.

This lance is enchanted with an illusion that makes it look twice as long as a regular lance. It also lacks the reach property.

Plex.name: Sneezing Powder
Plex.description: This light powder hangs in the air for up to one minute, filling the volume of a 10ft sphere. A creature entering or starting it’s turn in this cloud immediately uses it’s reaction to sneeze.

Plex.name: Phantasmal Horror
Plex.description:
You select a creature you can see within range and create an illusion of its worst nightmares, which only it can see.

The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed it takes 4d10 psychic damage and is frightened. On a successful save, the spell ends. For the duration of the spell this effect repeats at the start of each of the target's turns.

If the target's CR is less than the spell level and it's not not immune to being frightened, the dies on a failed saving throw.

At Higher Levels
When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d10 for each slot level above 4th.

Plex.name: Minor Illusion
Plex.description:
You create a sound or an image of an object within range that lasts for the duration. The illusion also ends if you dismiss it as an action or cast this spell again.

If you create a sound, its volume can range from a whisper to a scream. It can be your voice, someone else's voice, a lion's roar, a beating of drums, or any other sound you choose. The sound continues unabated throughout the duration, or you can make discrete sounds at different times before the spell ends.

If you create an image of an object—such as a chair, muddy footprints, or a small chest—it must be no larger than a 5-foot cube. The image can't create sound, light, smell, or any other sensory effect. Physical interaction with the image reveals it to be an illusion, because things can pass through it.

If a creature uses its action to examine the sound or image, the creature can determine that it is an illusion with a successful [[/skill investigation dc=@attributes.spelldc format=long]] against your spell save DC. If a creature discerns the illusion for what it is, the illusion becomes faint to the creature.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Green Dragon Heritage
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
You can, as a bonus action, consume any kind of poison before making a poison breath to apply it's effects to all targets hit.

Any target that fails the saving throw against your breath also fails the saving throw against the poison. Any that succeeds the saving throw against your breath, also succeeds the saving throw against the poison.

For the purposes of dealing damage you treat immunity to poison as resistance instead.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Dangerous Breath
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
If you have access to a breath weapon attack from a class or subclass, you gain a number of resource-free uses per day equal to your proficiency modifier.

This replaces your Dragonborn's Breath Weapon.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Unarmored Defense (Monk)
Shalkoc Zornax.description: Beginning at 1st level, while you are wearing no armor and not wielding a shield, your AC equals 10 + your Dexterity modifier + your Wisdom modifier.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Martial Arts
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
Your practice of martial arts gives you mastery of combat styles that use unarmed strikes and monk weapons, which are @item[shortsword|phb|shortswords] and any simple melee weapons that don't have the two-handed or heavy property.

You gain the following benefits while you are unarmed or wielding only monk weapons and you aren't wearing armor or wielding a @item[shield|phb].

  • You can use Dexterity instead of Strength for the attack and damage rolls of your unarmed strikes and monk weapons.
  • You can roll a [[/r d4]] in place of the normal damage of your unarmed strike or monk weapon. This die changes as you gain monk levels, as shown in the Martial Arts column of the Monk table.
  • You can make one unarmed strike as a bonus action on each of your turns.

Certain monasteries use specialized forms of the monk weapons. For example, you might use a club that is two lengths of wood connected by a short chain (called a nunchaku) or a sickle with a shorter, straighter blade (called a kama).

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Step of the Wind
Shalkoc Zornax.description: You can spend 1 ki point to both Dash and Dodge as a single bonus action on your turn.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Flurry of Blows
Shalkoc Zornax.description: You can spend 1 ki point to make two quick unarmed strikes as a bonus action.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Unarmored Movement
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
Starting at 2nd level, your speed increases by 10 feet while you are not wearing armor or wielding a shield. This bonus increases when you reach certain monk levels, as shown in the Monk table.

At 9th level, you gain the ability to move along vertical surfaces and across liquids on your turn without falling during the move.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Deflect Missiles
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
Whenever you are attacked by a ranged weapon attack, you can spend 1 Ki point to deflect or catch the missile. When you do so, the damage you take from the attack is [[/roll 1d10+@abilities.dex.mod+@classes.monk.levels # Deflect Missiles damage reduction: ]]{reduced by 1d10 + your Dexterity modifier + your monk level}.

If you have at least one free hand and if the missile is small enough for you to hold in one hand, you catch it and can immediately throw it back at your attacker.

The attack you make to do so is a ranged attack with unlimited range but counts as an unarmed strike for all other purposes.

Starting at 10th level, you can use this feature when you're hit by both ranged spell attacks as well as ranged weapon attacks.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Slow Fall
Shalkoc Zornax.description: Beginning at 4th level, you can use your reaction when you fall to reduce any falling damage you take by an amount equal to five times your monk level: [[@classes.monk.levels*5]]

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Quickened Healing
Shalkoc Zornax.description: As an action, you can spend 2 ki points and roll a Martial Arts die. You regain a number of hit points equal to the number rolled plus your proficiency bonus.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Stunning Strike
Shalkoc Zornax.description: You can interfere with the flow of ki in an opponent's body. When you hit another creature with a melee weapon attack, you can spend 1 ki point to attempt a stunning strike. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be &Reference[condition=stunned] until the end of your next turn.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Extra Attack
Shalkoc Zornax.description: Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice, instead of once, whenever you take the Attack action on your turn.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Evasion
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
Your instinctive agility lets you dodge out of the way of certain area effects, such as a blue dragon's lightning breath or a fireball spell.
When you are subjected to an effect that allows you to make a Dexterity saving throw to take only half damage, you instead take no damage if you succeed on the saving throw, and only half damage if you fail.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Stillness of Mind
Shalkoc Zornax.description: You can use your action to end any effects on yourself that are causing you to be &Reference[condition=charmed] or &Reference[condition=frightened].

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Unarmed Strike (Draconic Strike)
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
Draconic Strike

When you damage a target with an unarmed strike, you can change the damage type to acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Draconic Presence
Shalkoc Zornax.description: If you fail a Charisma (Intimidation) or Charisma (Persuasion) check, you can use your reaction to reroll the check, as you tap into the mighty presence of dragons. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Wings Unfurled
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
As a bonus action, you can unfurl draconic wings from your back for 1 minute, giving yourself a flying speed equal to your walking speed.

You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Poisoner
Shalkoc Zornax.description: When you make a damage roll that deals poison damage, it ignores resistance to poison damage. If you would otherwise treat immunity to poison damage as resistance, you now ignore immunity to poison damage as well.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Cook's Utensils
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
These special tools include the items needed to pursue a craft or trade in cookery.

Proficiency with a set of artisan's tools lets you add your proficiency bonus to any ability checks you make using the tools in your craft. Each type of artisan's tools requires a separate proficiency.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Chromatic Hardening
Shalkoc Zornax.description: At the end of your turn, if you've dealt damage of at least 4 different chromatic damage types (acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison) during your turn, you gain temporary hit points equal to your level.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Figurine of a Rat
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
Conjure a rat familiar as if casting the spell "Find Familiar". You can have up to three rats summoned at a time and familiars summoned by this item can telepathically communicate with you and share their visual or auditory senses while they are within 1 mile of you.

You can use this item to conjure a rat familiar 6 times before you have to recharge it by offering up a ratatouille worth 100gp.

If these familiars get within 10ft of a gargantuan sized creature before being noticed by it, they can scare it.
- One rat doing so frightens the creature for one round.
- Two rats doing so stuns the creature for one round.
- Three rats doing so paralyses the creature for one round.
These effects bypass any condition immunities the creature might have.
Once a creature has been affected this way, it becomes immune to being frightened, stunned or paralysed this way again for 24 hours.

Note: Each activation of this item summons one familiar; to recharge it please notify the DM (haven't implemented a way to let you do that yourself yet).

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Breath of the Dragon
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
You can channel destructive waves of energy, like those created by the dragons you emulate. When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can replace one of the attacks with an exhalation of draconic energy in a 20-foot cone or a 30-foot line that is 5 feet wide. Choose a damage type: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity saving throw against your Ki save DC, taking damage of the chosen type equal to two rolls of your Martial Arts die on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

The damage of this feature increases to three and four rolls of your Martial Arts die at 11th and 17th level respectively.

You can use this feature a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest. Alternatively you can spend 2 Ki points to use this feature.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Potion of Legendary Resistance
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
The way the potion shimmers is not unlike looking through a kaleidoscope.

When you drink this potion, you gain one Legendary Resistance for 8 hours. Spending it allows you to nullify the effect a single attack, spell, or ability would have on you.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Slumbering Dragon Vessel
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
This vessel can be a potion bottle, drinking horn, or other container meant to hold a liquid.

As a bonus action, if the vessel is empty, you can speak the command word to fill the vessel with one of the following (your choice): ale, olive oil, a potion of healing, or a potion of climbing. Once this property is used, it can't be used until you finish a long rest.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: +3 Dragonhide Belt
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
(requires attunement by a monk)

This finely detailed belt is made of dragonhide. While wearing it, you gain a +3 bonus to the saving throw DCs of your ki features. In addition, you can use an action to regain ki points equal to a roll of your Martial Arts die. You can't use this action again until the next dawn.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Potion of Water Breathing
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
Its cloudy green fluid smells of the sea and has a jellyfish-like bubble floating in it.

You can breathe underwater for 1 hour after drinking this potion.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Continual Flame Gem
Shalkoc Zornax.description: The gem gives the look of a torch that burns providing bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Purity of Body
Shalkoc Zornax.description: Your mastery of the Ki flowing through you makes you immune to disease and allows you to use your Deflect Missiles feature on ranged spell attacks as well as ranged weapon attacks.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Fine Clothes
Shalkoc Zornax.description: Formal outfits for the entire party, except Plex which is too big in size.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Circlet of Wisdom
Shalkoc Zornax.description: This circlet grants a +2 bonus to the wearer’s Wisdom score when attuned.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Shifting Stances
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
For centuries, great warriors have looked to nature to find inspiration in battle. Countless monastic orders have crafted intricate unarmed fighting styles based on the deadliness and grace of natural creatures.

You can spend 1 Ki to enter a stance or shift from one to another, imitating the movements of the creature that inspired the stance's style. This stance lasts until you choose to end it, until you enter a different stance, or until combat ends.

You can enter a stance, change to a different stance, or end a stance only once per turn as a free action.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Mantis Style
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
Based on the hunting techniques of the praying mantis, practitioners of this style fight with their hands turned down to emulate the insect’s sharp grasping forelimbs. Mantis style uses precise, accurate strikes to pinpoint an opponent’s vital areas, such as eyes, throat, and pressure points.

Embodying the style of the mantis, lets you add your proficiency bonus to your regular Ki save DC when you use Stunning Strike but the style also reduces your AC by an amount equal to your proficiency bonus.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Tiger Style
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
This style seeks to emulate the power and fury of the great tiger. Practitioners use their hands like claws, perfecting overpowering double hand strikes and driving attack chains.

The tiger style adds an amount of damage equal to your proficiency bonus to all natural weapon attacks you make but reduces your Ki save DC by the same amount.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Turtle Style
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
Channeling the turtle’s legendary defense, practitioners of this style adopt a low, stable posture. Mobility is reduced, but they become a bastion of defense, capable of withstanding powerful strikes with calm composure.

The turtle style grants you a bonus to your AC equal to your proficiency bonus but the maximum distance you can move during each of your turns is limited to a number of feet equal to 5 times your proficiency bonus.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Drunken Brawler's Dancing Shoes
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
When a creature misses you with a melee attack, you can spend 1 Ki to cause that attack to hit one creature of your choice that you can see within 5ft.

If the attack missed you by 5 or more, you regain 1 Ki.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Dodge
Shalkoc Zornax.description: When you take the Dodge action, you focus entirely on avoiding attacks. Until the start of your next turn, any attack roll made against you has disadvantage if you can see the attacker, and you make Dexterity saving throws with advantage. You lose this benefit if you are incapacitated (as explained in the appendix) or if your speed drops to 0.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Handwraps of Swift Strikes
Shalkoc Zornax.description: When you use Flurry of Blows and both attacks hit, you can immediately make one additional unarmed strike as a free action.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Guardian Scale of Transmutation
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
A creature can only have one Guardian Scale equipped at any given time.

While you have this scale equipped, you can cast @UUID[Compendium.talia-custom.customItems.Item.uA25JwLN2HLmf0zY]{Guardian of Nature} (1/day) and @UUID[Compendium.talia-custom.customItems.Item.TGZYfNKcSo9lL4Hm]{Thorn Whip}.

The ancient magic of this scale alters these spells. They require no concentration or components, can be cast while raging and have a flat spell save DC of [[12 + @prof]] and a flat spell attack bonus of [[4+@prof]].

Additionally, the cantrip this item grants has a casting time of 1 bonus action.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Guardian Scale of Divination
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
A creature can only have one Guardian Scale equipped at any given time.

While you have this scale equipped, you can cast @UUID[Compendium.talia-custom.customItems.Item.9zmCEIQR2p0sXMZY]{Arcane Eye} (1/day) and @UUID[Compendium.talia-custom.customItems.Item.4AvVLilynC0hoSMD]{Revelation Through Battle}.

The ancient magic of this scale alters these spells. They require no concentration or components, can be cast while raging and have a flat spell save DC of [[12 + @prof]] and a flat spell attack bonus of [[4+@prof]].

Additionally, the cantrip this item grants has a casting time of 1 bonus action.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Mythic Power
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
The path of the Dragon is reserved for those of draconic bloodline, heirs to the divine legacy of Tiamat and Bahamut. This journey represents a rite of passage, unlocking the raw power and profound wisdom inherent in their heritage. From the awakening of their ancestral essence to a final, awe-inspiring transformation into a dragon, the path embodies the might and majesty of the ancient legends.

Mythic characters can draw upon a wellspring of power to accomplish amazing deeds and cheat fate. This power is used by a number of different abilities.

Each week, you can expend an amount of mythic power equal to 2 + twice your mythic rank.

This amount is your maximum amount of mythic power. If an ability allows you to regain uses of your mythic power, you can never have more than this amount.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Legendary Resistance
Shalkoc Zornax.description: You can expend 1 Mythic Power as a free action to immediately gain and use &Reference[legres].

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Rejuvenation
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
Upon your death, if your life essence is not captured, it returns to your hoard, where it coalesces into an egg. Any items you were wearing or carrying at the time of death are also recalled to your hoard. After [[/r 1d10]] days, the egg hatches, and you are reborn as a tiny pseudodragon, retaining all memories from your previous lives.

After an additional [[/r 1d20]] days, your pseudodragon form grows to small size. Another [[/r 1d20]] days later, you are fully restored and can transform back into your dragonborn form, regaining all features and abilities you possessed before your death.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Torpor
Shalkoc Zornax.description: A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a [[/save con 15 format=long]] or become &Reference[poisoned] for 4d6 hours. The &Reference[poisoned] creature is &Reference[incapacitated].

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Tiamat's Tear
Shalkoc Zornax.description: Only a dragonborn of royal blood can use this unique gemstone to command the movements of the flying island Nabu-Anshar.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Ki
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
Your training allows you to harness the mystic energy of ki. Your access to this energy is represented by a number of ki points, the maximum number of which is equal to your monk level.

You can spend these points to fuel various ki features.

When you spend a ki point, it is unavailable until you finish a short or long rest, at the end of which you draw all of your expended ki back into yourself. You must spend at least 30 minutes of the rest meditating to regain your ki points.

Some of your ki features require your target to make a saving throw to resist the feature's effects. The saving throw DC is calculated as follows:

Ki save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Aspect of the Wyrm
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
The power of your draconic spirit now radiates from you, warding your allies.

As a bonus action, you create an aura around you that lasts for 1 minute and gives you and your allies within 20 feet of you resistance against all chromatic damage types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, and poison.

Once you use this ability, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest, unless you expend 4 Ki points to use it again.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Wyrmreaver Gauntlets
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
Requires attunement by a monk

Originally crafted for ground-bound giant brawlers to fight against dragons and other enormous predators of the sky, these studded gauntlets are engraved with the dragon rune.

While you are wearing these gauntlets, your unarmed strike deals an additional 1d6 force damage on a hit.

Guarding Runes

You have resistance to one of the following damage types of your choice: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison. You can change the chosen type when you finish a long rest.

Invoking the Runes

As a bonus action, you can invoke the gauntlets' runes and summon two enormous spectral fists that envelop the gauntlets and mimic your hand motions. The fists can also launch themselves to strike distant opponents, returning immediately to your space after they hit or miss.

The fists last for 1 minute or until you are Incapacitated. While the spectral fists are active, unarmed strikes you make on your turn have a reach of 30 feet, and when you hit a creature with an opportunity attack made with your unarmed strike, the creature must succeed on a DC 11 Strength saving throw or fall Prone.

Once the runes have been invoked, they can't be invoked again until the next dawn.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Ring of Free Action
Shalkoc Zornax.description: While you wear this ring, &Reference[rule=difficultterrain]{difficult terrain} doesn't cost you extra movement. In addition, magic can neither reduce your speed nor cause you to be &Reference[condition=paralyzed] or &Reference[condition=restrained].

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Activated: Greater Invisibility - 4th
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
4th Level

You or a creature you touch becomes &Reference[condition=invisible] until the spell ends. Anything the target is wearing or carrying is &Reference[condition=invisible] as long as it is on the target's person.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Potion of Cold Resistance
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
The potion is a plain indescriminate color and smells slightly foul.

When you drink this potion, you gain resistance to Cold type damage for 1 hour.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Potion of Speed
Shalkoc Zornax.description: When you drink this potion, you gain the effect of the Haste spell for 1 minute (no concentration required). The potion's yellow fluid is streaked with black and swirls on its own.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Dragon "Eyelashes"
Shalkoc Zornax.description: Actually are Eyelids.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Snack Pack
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
Wondrous item

This bag can only hold food items, keeping them fresh indefinitely.

This bag has an interior space considerably larger than its outside dimensions, roughly 2 feet in diameter at the mouth and 4 feet deep. The bag can hold up to 500 pounds, not exceeding a volume of 64 cubic feet. The bag weighs 3 pounds, regardless of its contents. Retrieving an item from the bag requires an action.

If the bag is overloaded, pierced, or torn, it ruptures and is destroyed, and its contents spill forth unharmed. If the bag is turned inside out, its contents spill forth, unharmed, but the bag must be put right before it can be used again.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Grilled Steak
Shalkoc Zornax.description: A meticulously cooked slice of premium meat, often beef, cooked with precision and often with a side by your choice of fresh greens or soft mashed potatoes.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Grilled Ribs
Shalkoc Zornax.description: Fall-off-the-bone ribs, coated in sweet and tangy homemade sauces, are a beloved favorite at most taverns, often served for events or celebrations, and eagerly enjoyed by adventurers returning triumphant from their quests or missions.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Thorn Whip
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
You create a long, vine-like whip covered in thorns that lashes out at your command toward a creature in range. Make a melee spell attack against the target. If the attack hits, the creature takes [[/damage 1d6 type=piercing]] damage, and if the creature is Large or smaller, you pull the creature up to 10 feet closer to you.

This spell's damage increases by [[/r 1d6]] when you reach 5th level ([[/damage 2d6]]), 11th level ([[/damage 3d6]]), and 17th level ([[/damage 4d6]]).

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Guardian of Nature
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
A nature spirit answers your call and transforms you into a powerful guardian. The transformation lasts until the spell ends. You choose one of the following forms to assume: Primal Beast or Great Tree.

Primal Beast

Bestial fur covers your body, your facial features become feral, and you gain the following benefits:

  • Your walking speed increases by 10 feet.
  • You gain &Reference[rule=darkvision] with a range of 120 feet.
  • You make Strength-based attack rolls with advantage.
  • Your melee weapon attacks deal an extra [[/damage 1d6 type=force]] damage on a hit.

Great Tree

Your skin appears barky, leaves sprout from your hair, and you gain the following benefits:

  • You gain 10 temporary hit points.
  • You make Constitution saving throws with advantage.
  • You make Dexterity- and Wisdom-based attack rolls with advantage.
  • While you are on the ground, the ground within 15 feet of you is &Reference[rule=difficultterrain]{difficult terrain} for your enemies.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Draconic Amulet of Greed
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
The damage you deal with your breath is increased by 1dx where x is your gp/1000.

Curse

This amulet is cursed and equipping it extends the curse to you. As long as you remain cursed, you are unwilling to part with the amulet, keeping it on your person at all times and refusing to take it off for more than a few minutes.

While cursed, you will become increasingly greedy and megalomaniacal, refusing to heed the advice of others, lashing out at the slightest perceived insult, and hording your valuables and refusing to spend any unless absolutely necessary.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Dried Meat
Shalkoc Zornax.description: The process of drying meat is long and extensive. In some particular cases, for the highest quality of dried meat, it can take over a year. It is highly sought after due to its extended shelf life, and depending on the meat used, it is, quite frankly, delicious.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Gift of the Metallic Dragon
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
You've manifested some of the power of metallic dragons, granting you the following benefits:

  • Ability Score Increase. Increase your Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma by 1, to a maximum of 20. (WIS)

  • Draconic Healing. You learn the Cure Wounds spell. You can cast this spell without expending a spell slot. Once you cast this spell in this way, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast this spell using spell slots you have. The spell's spellcasting ability is the ability increased by this feat.

  • Protective Wings. You can manifest protective wings that can shield you or others. When you or another creature you can see within 5 feet of you is hit by an attack roll, you can use your reaction to manifest spectral wings from your back for a moment. You grant a bonus to the target's AC equal to your proficiency bonus against that attack roll, potentially causing it to miss. You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Cure Wounds
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
A creature you touch regains a number of hit points equal to [[/r 2d8]] + your spellcasting ability modifier. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

At Higher Levels.
When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the healing increases by [[/r 2d8]] for each slot level above 1st.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Ioun Stone, Language Knowledge
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
An Ioun stone is named after Ioun, a god of knowledge and prophecy revered on some worlds. Many types of Ioun stone exist, each type a distinct combination of shape and color.

When you use an action to toss one of these stones into the air, the stone orbits your head at a distance of [[/r 1d3]] feet and confers a benefit to you. Thereafter, another creature must use an action to grasp or net the stone to separate it from you, either by making a successful attack roll against AC 24 or a successful DC 24 Dexterity (&Reference[skill=Acrobatics]) check. You can use an action to seize and stow the stone, ending its effect.

A stone has AC 24, 10 hit points, and resistance to all damage. It is considered to be an object that is being worn while it orbits your head.

You are fluent in one additional language while this pulsating bit of red jeweled crystal orbits your head. The DM chooses the language bestowed by the stone.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Chili Pepper
Shalkoc Zornax.description: Harvested usually in most warm climates, it is used mainly as a spice in cuisines to add some "warmth" to the dish.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Ginger
Shalkoc Zornax.description: Ginger, is widely used as a spice and folk medicine. It is provided as tea for those who have weak stomachs to combat nausea, among other things.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Bread
Shalkoc Zornax.description: Bread is a staple food made from dough that has been baked. It comes in a variety of shapes, sizes, and flavors. It is often sold as a side in most taverns and inns for any of the main meals they serve.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Chef
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
Time spent mastering the culinary arts has paid off, increasing your Dexterity score by 1, to a maximum of 20, and granting you proficiency with cook's utensils if you didn't already have it.

If you have ingredients and cook's utensils on hand, you can prepare up to 10 meals during one hour of dedicated work or as part of a short or long rest. Each meal requires one food and, optionally, one spice.

When preparing a meal, you can choose to enhance either its restorative or preventative properties, granting it one of the following benefits:

  • Restorative. The creature regains a number of hit points equal to 1d8 * your proficiency bonus.

  • Preventative. The creature gains a number of temporary hit points equal to 2d4 * your proficiency bonus.

Meals retain these enhanced properties only while fresh, meaning they must be consumed within 30 minutes of preparation. A creature that consumes a fresh meal gains the selected benefit as well as the effect of any spice used to flavor the meal.

A creature can benefit from only one enhanced meal per rest period.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Potion of Superior Healing
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
The potion's red liquid glimmers when agitated.

You regain 8d4 + 8 hit points when you drink this potion.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Potion of Growth
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
The red in the potion's liquid continuously expands from a tiny bead to color the clear liquid around it and then contracts. Shaking the bottle fails to interrupt this process.

When you drink this potion, you gain the "enlarge" effect of the enlarge/reduce spell for 1d4 hours (no concentration required):

While enlarged, your size is increased by one category and your weight is multiplied by eight.
You have advantage on Strength checks and saving throws and your attacks with weapons deal an additional 1d4 damage.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Drow Poison
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
This poison is typically made only by the drow, and only in a place far removed from sunlight.

A creature subjected to this poison must succeed on a [[/save con 13 format=long]] or be &Reference[poisoned] for 1 hour. If the saving throw fails by 5 or more, the creature is also &Reference[unconscious] while poisoned in this way. The creature wakes up if it takes damage or if another creature takes an action to shake it awake.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Dried Meat
Shalkoc Zornax.description: The process of drying meat is long and extensive. In some particular cases, for the highest quality of dried meat, it can take over a year. It is highly sought after due to its extended shelf life, and depending on the meat used, it is, quite frankly, delicious.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Instinctive Greed
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
You develop an innate urge to accumulate wealth and amass a hoard of treasure in a single location, jealously guarding it from friend and foe alike.

If the total value of coins (platinum, gold, electrum, silver, and copper) and loot in your hoard exceeds the total value of coins and loot you carry on your person, you gain the following benefits:

  • When you deal poison damage, you deal additional poison damage equal to your mythic rank. This bonus is doubled when you deal poison damage with your breath weapon.

  • Gain a bonus to [[/skill dec]], [[/skill itm]], [[/skill per]], [[/skill ins]], [[/skill prc]], and [[/skill ste]] checks equal to your mythic rank.

If the total value of your hoard exceeds the combined value of coins and loot carried by you and all other party members, all bonuses granted by this feat are doubled.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Mystifying Miasma
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
As an action, you can expend 1 Mythic Power to create a cloud of mind-altering fog in a 1-mile radius that lasts for 1 hour.

The fog lightly obscures the area, and creatures inside it are unaware of their minds and senses being distorted by the miasma unless they are either immune to &Reference[illusion] or &Reference[enchantment] magic, succeed on a [[/check inv dc=30]] or [[/check prc dc=30]] check, or possess &Reference[rule=truesight]. Even if a creature becomes aware of the miasma’s mind-altering properties, they still suffer its effects as long as they remain within the fog.

The miasma distorts the mind and senses of other creatures while enhancing your ability to take advantage of their altered state of mind. While inside the area:

  • You have advantage on saving throws against being &Reference[charmed] or &Reference[frightened] as well as on [[/skill ste]], [[/skill prc]], [[/skill ins]], and [[/skill dec]] checks.

  • Other creatures have disadvantage on saving throws against being &Reference[charmed] or &Reference[frightened] as well as on [[/skill prc]], [[/skill ins]], and [[/skill sur]] checks.

Additionally, when you see a creature within the miasma make an attack, you can use your reaction to manipulate their perception, causing them to mistake another creature of your choice for their intended target, provided the new target is a valid option for the attack (e.g., within range). If the attacker is aware of the miasma's mind altering properties, they can make a [[/save wis format=long]] against your ki save DC to avoid the redirection of that attack.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Jump
Shalkoc Zornax.description: Using your bonus action, you can jump up to [[/r @talia.jumpDistance]] ft.

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Grapple
Shalkoc Zornax.description:
When you want to grab a creature or wrestle with it, you can use the Attack action to make a special melee attack, a grapple. If you're able to make multiple attacks with the Attack action, this attack replaces one of them. The target of your grapple must be no more than one size larger than you, and it must be within your reach.

Using at least one free hand, you try to seize the target by making a grapple check, a [[/skill ath format=long]] contested by the target's [[/skill ath format=long]] or [[/skill acr format=long]] (the target chooses the ability to use). You succeed automatically if the target is incapacitated. If you succeed, you subject the target to the &Reference[grappled] effect. The condition specifies the things that end it, and you can release the target whenever you like (no action required).

Shalkoc Zornax.name: Boots of Blinding Speed
Shalkoc Zornax.description: While worn, your walking speed is increased by 30ft and you are &Reference[blinded].
